On Tue, Dec 23, 2003 at 05:16:33PM +0100, Jan Algermissen wrote:
> Hi Mark--
> 
> I really, really like your way[1] of subscribing to a feed:
> 
> telnet proxy.markbaker.ca 80
> MONITOR http://www.pacificspirit.com/blog/index.rdf HTTP/1.1
> Host: www.pacificspirit.com
> Reply-To: http://www.markbaker.ca/private/
> Content-Length: 0 
> 
> I wonder...
> 
> - if you have implemented this (because if you didn't, I think I will)

Yes, a couple of years ago at Idokorro/Planetfred.  It was implemented
as an HTTP proxy, and was also usable as a surrogate (reverse proxy).

> - since the remote host likely won't understand MONITOR, does your
>   proxy pull the resource in certain time intervals?

It first asks the origin server if it supports MONITOR, and if so passes
it on.  If not, yes, it polls.

> - Most importantly: what is the format (DTD/schema/namespace/mime-type)
>   that the reply-to container accepts? Propably some RDF-Form might help
>   here ;-)  Or some additional 'Accept-Reply' header?

IIRC, I think we extended Accept semantics (ick!) to apply to the
eventual POST request to the Reply-To URI, rather than the response to
the MONITOR request.  That's obviously a hack though.

> Anyhow...very nice!

Thanks.  FWIW, MONITOR is going to be part of Waka;

  http://gbiv.com/protocols/waka/

and has also been discussed here several times.  Check the archives,
and also the Wiki, for example;

  http://internet.conveyor.com/RESTwiki/moin.cgi/HttpEvents

Mark.
